Combine Multiple Contexts

Source: R/context-combine.R
cassidy_context_combined.Rd

Combines multiple context objects into a single context for use with cassidy_chat(). Contexts are joined with separators to maintain clarity.

Usage

cassidy_context_combined(..., sep = "\n\n---\n\n")

Arguments

...

Context objects to combine. Can be cassidy_context objects, cassidy_df_description objects, character strings, or lists.

sep

Character string used to separate contexts. Defaults to a horizontal rule for readability.

Value

A cassidy_context object containing all combined contexts.

See also

cassidy_context_project(), cassidy_describe_file(), cassidy_context_data(), cassidy_chat()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  # Combine project context with a file
  combined <- cassidy_context_combined(
    cassidy_context_project(),
    cassidy_describe_file("R/my-function.R")
  )

  # Use directly in chat
  cassidy_chat("Review this code", context = combined)

  # Combine multiple files
  cassidy_chat("Compare these implementations", context =
    cassidy_context_combined(
      cassidy_describe_file("R/old-approach.R"),
      cassidy_describe_file("R/new-approach.R")
    )
  )
} # }
